action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To require reports on the immigration status of individuals convicted of State crimes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Secure Our Border and Our Streets Act of 2023.

section.header: Reporting requirements related to the immigration status of individuals convicted of crimes

subsection.text: Beginning in the first fiscal year that begins after the date of enactment of this Act, in order to be eligible to receive Federal funds from the Department of Justice, a State shallâ€”

paragraph.text: document the immigration status of each individual arrested in that State; and
submit to the Attorney General, on an annual basis, information on the immigration status of each individual convicted of a crime under the laws of the State during the previous fiscal year.

subsection.text: Not later than the end of the first fiscal year that begins after the date of enactment of this Act and annually thereafter, the Attorney General shall submit to Congress a report that contains the information reported to the Attorney General under subsection (a).
